ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus associated with COVID-19
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Onset of left-sided unilateral tinnitus occurred immediately following a positive COVID-19 diagnosis and anosmia.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: High-frequency sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometry revealed bilateral mild SNHL at 4 kHz and above, extending to mild-to-moderate loss in ultra-high frequencies (9-16 kHz).

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Anxiety and Depression
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Patient exhibited significant anxiety regarding long-term COVID effects, which likely exacerbates tinnitus perception.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the severity and functional impact of tinnitus (THI, TFI).
To determine hearing thresholds, including ultra-high frequencies (9-16 kHz).
To assess speech recognition thresholds and word recognition scores.
To evaluate for hyperacusis or reduced loudness discomfort levels.
To characterize tinnitus pitch, loudness, masking levels, and residual inhibition.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presented with left-sided tinnitus starting immediately after a COVID-19 diagnosis. Testing revealed bilateral mild sensorineural hearing loss at 4000 Hz and above, with mild-to-moderate loss in the ultra-high frequencies (9-16 kHz). Speech recognition was excellent, and loudness tolerance was normal. Tinnitus evaluation showed partial residual inhibition. Self-report scores (THI 72, TFI 84) indicated severely bothersome tinnitus exacerbated by significant anxiety.

tests.name: Self-Report Scales
tests.result_summary: THI score of 72 and TFI score of 84, indicating severely bothersome tinnitus.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral mild SNHL at 4000 Hz and above; mild-to-moderate loss from 9 kHz through 16 kHz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs at 25 dB HL bilaterally; WRS 96% at 55 dB HL bilaterally.

tests.name: Loudness Tolerance
tests.result_summary: LDLs > 90 dB HL for speech and pure tones (normal).

tests.name: Tinnitus Evaluation
tests.result_summary: Pitch and loudness matched; MML obtained; partial residual inhibition for 35 seconds.

proposed_items: Binaural amplification (recommended but declined due to budget)
Relaxation techniques (Mindfulness Based Tinnitus Stress Reduction)
counseling_actions: Counseling on using sound therapy at a mixing point volume
Instruction to use sound therapy when tinnitus is most bothersome
Counseling regarding referral to a mental health professional for anxiety

escalation.rationale_short: Referral recommended to address significant anxiety and depression symptoms related to the COVID-19 diagnosis and tinnitus.

follow_up_plan.objective: Return if symptoms persist; monitor hearing and tinnitus status.

expected_outcome: Patient declined binaural amplification due to budget constraints.
Patient instructed to use a smartphone app for sound therapy set to a mixing point.
Patient encouraged to practice relaxation techniques such as Mindfulness Based Tinnitus Stress Reduction (MBTSR).
Referral to a mental health professional was recommended to address anxiety and depression.
